Certainly! One specific policy that Astrakhan has implemented to promote social justice is the "Charter for the Rights of the Child in the Astrakhan Region." This charter was developed in collaboration with UNICEF and aims to protect the rights of children in the region.

The charter outlines a series of steps that should be taken to ensure that children in Astrakhan have access to education, healthcare, and other essential services, regardless of their socioeconomic status or other factors. For example, it sets out targets for reducing child mortality rates and improving access to education and nutrition.

By implementing this charter, Astrakhan has taken a proactive approach to promoting social justice and equality for children in the region. It has helped to ensure that all children have the opportunity to reach their full potential and has set a standard for other regions and countries to follow.
